thread.title: Pixel Film Studios Releases ProWall Kinetic Color for FCPX.
thread.title_full: Pixel Film Studios Releases ProWall Kinetic Color for FCPX. - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Pixel Film Studios Releases ProWall Kinetic Color for FCPX.
text:
ProWall Kinetic Color is released by Pixel Film Studios for Final Cut Pro X.
Aliso Viejo, CA (PRWEB) September 30, 2015
ProWall Kinetic Color is a set of over 35 video wall design tools made exclusively for Final Cut Pro X . ProWall Kinetic Color is completely keyframeless, allowing FCPX users to animate pictures, videos, and personal media with drag & drop ease. Slide or scale colorful panels to reveal videos, pictures, and personal media without having to set a single keyframe, all within Final Cut Pro X.
ProWall Kinetic Color is a set of over 35 video wall design tools made with FCPX users in mind. With ProWall users can create an endless flow of animated video without having to set a single keyframe. ProWall Kinetic Color's intuitive tool set is neatly categorized, allowing users to navigate the plugin with absolute ease.
ProWall Kinetic Color features keyframeless animations. Simply drop a ProWall preset above media in the Final Cut Pro X timeline. Use the drop zones provided to insert your other photos or videos. ProWall Kinetic will instantly bring the scene to life.
ProWall Kinetic Color allows users to create any type of video wall layout within Final Cut Pro X. Easily time ProWall to musical beats by staggering presets in the Final Cut Pro X timeline. Utilize intuitive on-screen controls to rotate, scale, and reorient pieces of the video wall. Pixel Film Studios brings drag and drop ease to complex animations with ProWall Kinetic Color.
ProWall Kinetic Color is ready for use, however users can find advanced controls in the top-right FCPX inspector window. Included is the ability to adjust the animation method for video wall pieces and the adjustment layer below. ProWall Kinetic Color simplifies complex kinetic animations and provides users with amazing and time-saving functionality.
Established in 2006, Aliso Viejo, California-based Pixel Film Studios is an innovative developer of visual effects tools for the post-production and broadcast community. Their products are integrated with popular non-linear editing and compositing products from Apple FCPX. Apple, the Apple logo, Mac OS X, and Macintosh are registered trademarks of Apple Inc. in the U.S. and/or other countries. All other trademarks and trade names are the property of their respective owners.
